DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: AMARAL, P. P. R.;Amaral, P. P.;Amaral, Paulo P.;Amaral, Paulo P;AMARAL, PAULOP.;DE PAIVA AMARAL, PAULO

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Professor Assistente do Insper, exercendo atividade de ensino e pesquisa em Bioengenharia.

Possui graduao em Cincias Biolgicas pela Universidade de Braslia (2003), mestrado em Bioqumica pela Universidade de So Paulo (2006) e doutorado em Gentica Molecular pela University of Queensland, Australia (2011). Foi pesquisador da Universidade de Cambridge no CRUK/Wellcome Trust Gurdon Institute e no Milner Therapeutics Institute, com suporte da Royal Society and British Academy Newton International Fellowship, Corpus Christi College Research Fellowship e Borysiewicz Biomedical Sciences Fellowship. Tambm atuou na Indstria pelas empresas Pentail Enzymes (atual JĀNA BIO LTD), como co-fundador, e STORM Therapeutics Limited, como pesquisador e consultor. Tambm como professor visitante em diversas universidades, incluindo Campus Bio-Medico University of Rome (Unicampus) e Humanitas University Medical School de Milo, na Itlia, bem como Karolinska Institutet e Uppsala University, Sucia.

Sua pesquisa tem abrangido diversos mecanismos envolvidos no controle da atividade do genoma durante o desenvolvimento embrionrio, em clulas-tronco e em doenas, com foco especial em redes regulatrias envolvendo RNAs no-codificadores de protenas (noncoding RNAs) e suas modificaes covalentes (RNA modifications). Atual nfase em pesquisa no Insper na interseco de biologia molecular com bioengenharia e desenvolvimento de tcnicas e ferramentas analticas para o estudo de biomolculas.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Assistant Professor at Insper, Sao Paulo, Brazil. Graduation at Cincias Biolgicas at Universidade de Braslia (2003), MsC in Biochemistry at Universidade de So Paulo (2006) and PhD in Molecular Genetics at The University of Queensland (2011). Has experience in Biochemistry, focusing on Molecular Biology, and currently works in Bioengineering.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES:
2005 - 2006 - Instituto de Qumica, Universidade de So Paulo - Bolsista do Programa de Aperfeioamento de Ensino (PAE) - estgio como monitor na disciplina Bioqumica e Biologia Molecular do Gene (QBQ0217 e QBQ0317); co-organizador e monitor no Primeiro Curso de Vero de Bioqumica e Biologia Molecular (2006).

2008 - 2010 - University of Queensland - tutor in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology for the School of Chemistry and Molecular Biosciences, courses BIOC2000, BIOL3006 and BIOC3003 (2010); BIOC2000, BIOL3006 and BIOC3003 (2009); BIOC2012 and BIOL3006 (2008). University of Sao Paulo, Department of Biochemistry.

2017 - Exam marking for the Biochemistry Module of Part II Zoology and Natural Sciences Tripos Part II Biochemistry, University of Cambridge.

- Other Supervisions: Supervision of master?s degree and internship students, including: at the University of Queensland, co-supervision of honours and Masters students (Soohyun Kwon in 2009/2010, Anton Karslberg in 2010, Loreen Thurmann in 2010/2011). At the Gurdon Institute, a visiting student from the University of So Paulo (Fabio Pohl, April 2015 ? January 2016), and an ERASMUS trainee (part of the Masters in Molecular Biosciences from Heidelberg University) (Magdalena Bscher, January - April 2015). Also mentor to PhD students and young post-docs on the Gurdon Institute Postdoc Association (GIPA) Mentoring Scheme (March 2015 ? 2018).

- Peer-review of manuscripts for several Journals (including Bioinformatics, BMC Evolutionary Biology, EMBO Reports, Nucleic Acids Research, PLoS Computational Biology, PLoS Genetics, RNA Biology and RNA Journal) ? and co-reviewer for other journals such as Cell, Development Cell, Genome Research, Molecular Cell, Nature and PNAS.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: DEPLOY (Diagnostics to Empower Pathogen-detection in a LOw-income countrY)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Team DEPLOY seeks to develop and deploy innovative field diagnostic solutions that empower low and middle-income countries (LMICs) to combat infectious diseases. A modular platform to diagnose infectious diseases, using a state of the art lab-in-a-tent structure with sample extraction, PCR, ELISA, microscopy and Nanopore sequencing. Executed by Borys Fellows, the project included a field trip to Sierra Leone, from June 7 to 15, 2019, to test DEPLOY for detection of Yellow Fever, in collaboration with the University of Makeni.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: AMARAL, P. P. R.;Amaral, P. P.;Amaral, Paulo P.;Amaral, Paulo P;AMARAL, PAULOP.;DE PAIVA AMARAL, PAULO

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Milner Therapeutics Institute, University of Cambridge

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Co-founder of the company Pentail Enzymes Limited. Currently named JĀNA BIO LTD (UK Company number 11457883), the company combines bioinformatics to analyse personal genomics data, as well as genome editing, to create in silico and in vitro preclinical tests to assess drug toxicity, help to stratify clinical trials and reduce attrition rates in drug development.
